main event: Six lighted objects were observed zig-zagging in the sky over the USN Weather Station in Kodiak, Alaska on 25 October 1957.
interesting points: The objects were approximately three times the size of standard aircraft lights., The colors of the objects varied, including white, blue, purple, and orange., The objects moved in spurts and hovered before changing directions., The observation lasted for about 10 minutes., Conclusions suggested the objects were likely balloons despite the lack of known weather balloons in the area.
sighted object: six lighted objects with a star-like appearance
